meanings.definition: deceive or outwit (someone) by being cunning or skillful
meanings.sent1: She was tricking her friend into thinking it was her birthday today.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys tricking his little brother with magic tricks.
meanings.sent3: The cat was tricking the mouse by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The shadows were tricking the eye into seeing shapes that weren't there.
meanings.sent5: The magician was tricking the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: a deceptive or cunning action or scheme
meanings.sent1: The tricking of the fox led to a successful escape from the hunters.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his tricking and refused to fall for it.
meanings.sent3: The tricking of the students into believing it was a snow day was a hilarious prank.
meanings.sent4: His elaborate tricking to win the game impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The tricking of the enemy army allowed them to sneak past unnoticed.
